description: Evening boat rides, palace reflections and breeze, a soundtrack for Udiapur's lakeside escapes.

items.name: Haldighati
items.description: About 50 km from the city of Udaipur, Haldighati is a mountain pass in the hills of Aravali. The name comes from its yellow colour soil. It's historically significant as the Battle of Haldighati, in 1576, was fought here between the army of the third Mughal emperor, Akbar and the king of Mewar, Maharana Pratap Singh. One can visit the memorial of Chetak horse and Maharana Pratap Museum. It's one of the most important places to visit near Udaipur for those who are interested in history. This is one of the best places to visit near Udaipur airport.

items.name: Chittorgarh Fort
items.description: The colossal and majestic Chittorgarh Fort is one of the largest forts in India. With its seven giant gates that served as watchtowers, the cenotaphs, ‘Kirti Stambh', and ‘Vijay Stambh', the fort is the finest example of Rajput architecture. One must witness the splendour of the Fateh Prakash Palace, the Rana Kumbha Palace, and the Rani Padmini's Palace. This is one of the best places near Udaipur within 300 km.

items.name: Jaipur City Palace
items.description: Famous for serving as the seat of the Maharaja of Jaipur, City Palace is among the most iconic tourist attractions in Jaipur as well as one of the most wonderful places to visit near Udaipur. The palace is home to the beautiful Mubarak Mahal and the Chandra Mahal which are famed for their brilliant architecture and interiors. Situated right in the heart of Jaipur, this magnificent palace makes up for a great place to check out on a weekend getaway from Udaipur to Jaipur.
items.location_hint: Tulsi Marg, Gangori Bazaar, J.D.A. Market, Pink City, Jaipur, Rajasthan
items.entry_fee_text: INR 130 for adults (Indian), INR 70 for children (Indian), INR 500 for Foreigners

items.name: Mehrangarh Fort
items.description: Jodhpur's Mehrangarh Fort is among the biggest forts in India and is one of the most beautiful places near Udaipur that you can explore with your loved ones. Also called Mehran Fort, this majestic fortress was built in 1459 by Rao Jodha. When you're here, you can even spot imprints made by cannon balls that were fired on this fort during the old wars. The most intriguing part of the fort is its 7 gates that were built by Maharaja Man Singh to commemorate his victories. You should also visit these gates on your vacay.
items.entry_fee_text: INR 60 for Indians, INR 400 for Foreigners

items.name: Pushkar Lake
items.description: The Pushkar Lake is a revered pilgrimage site in Pushkar, Rajasthan that is frequented by worshippers and spiritual souls from all over the country. One can either watch the evening aarti on the ghats of this beautiful lake in the evening or take a dip in the afternoon to rid themselves of their sins. But no matter what you choose to do here, you'll find that this lake is among the most scenic places in Pushkar as well as one of the most peaceful tourist places near Udaipur.

items.name: Nakki Lake
items.description: Nakki Lake is among the most beautiful and peaceful lakes in Rajasthan, making it one of the best places to visit in Udaipur for couples, owing to its beauty and clear blue water that turn into amazing shades under the changing hues of the sky. It is said that this lake was dug out by the Gods themselves, which makes it a popular retreat and a great spot for boating in Mount Abu, one of the most beautiful hill stations in Rajasthan. But that's not all that fascinates people about this place. Nakki Lake is known to be among the best places near Udaipur, especially to the followers of Gandhi, courtesy of the fact Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were immersed here. It's a serene place to hang out with friends as it is surrounded by plenty of eating joints where you can sit, dine, and gaze at the sunset over the lake!

items.name: Brahma Temple
items.location_hint: Brahma Temple Rd, Ganahera, Pushkar, Rajasthan 305022

items.name: Om Banna Temple
items.description: If you're visiting Udaipur, nearby places like the Om Banna Temple should also be on your list. The shrine of the Bullet Baba is known to be among the most mysterious places in India because of the intriguing story behind its establishment. Instead of idols of Gods and Goddesses, people here worship an actual motorbike that once belonged to a man named Om Singh Rathore who had met with a tragic accident and had died at this spot while riding back home.

items.name: Umaid Bhawan Palace
items.description: The Umaid Bhawan Palace (also called Chittar Palace) is among the world's largest private residences and one of the most delightful tourist places near Udaipur in Rajasthan. While a part of this palace is closed for the public as it is still used as a residence by the Jodhpur Royal Family, a major part is accessible for visitors and has recently been converted into a lavish and gorgeous heritage hotel by the Taj Group of Hotels. The third section of this beautiful mansion is a museum that is dedicated to showcasing the 20th-century history of the Jodhpur Royal Family as well as the vintage automobiles owned by the royal family.
items.location_hint: Circuit House Rd, Cantt Area, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342006
items.entry_fee_text: INR 30 for Indians, INR 100 for Foreigners

items.name: Khwaja Garib Nawaz Dargah
items.location_hint: 11, Dargah Sharif, Khadim Mohalla, Diggi Bazaar, Ajmer, Rajasthan

items.name: Hawa Mahal
items.description: Coming to Rajasthan and not visiting Hawa Mahal is like going to Paris and not exploring the Eiffel Tower! Hawa Mahal is probably the most distinguished landmark of Jaipur and among the most exceptionally captivating places in Rajasthan. Tucked in the middle of a busy market area and smeared with radiant hues of pink, this wonderful tourist attraction in Jaipur attracts people in with its unusual appearance, interesting history, and bizarre features studded in the interiors. It was built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh way back in 1799 and was devoted to the very purpose its name signifies – providing a windy setup to the household women of the royal family so that they could comfortably witness the processions that passed through this very market.
items.location_hint: Hawa Mahal Road, Badi Chopad, J.D.A. Market, Kanwar Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan
items.entry_fee_text: INR 50 for Indians, INR 200 for Foreigners
